results.title: Wayleggo
results.creator_credit: Robert Kingsbury, Oxley Hughan, Geoffrey Scott and New Zealand National Film Unit
results.brief_description: Shows some activities of a mountain sheep station in New Zealand, including training of dogs and the Autumn muster to move sheep below the snow line.

results.title: Wayfinder Live (2016)
results.brief_description: In 2016 Swinburne University developed a location-based game designed for councils to increase social connection. Users were rewarded with unlockable augmented/mixed reality artworks throughout Melbourne.

constellations_other.name: Location and exploration
constellations_other.description: A comparative look at location-based gaming and street art and how the way we experience these two art forms has moved out of traditional spaces and onto the street.

results.description: In 2016 Swinburne University developed a location-based game designed for councils to increase social connection. Users were rewarded with unlockable augmented/mixed reality artworks throughout Melbourne.

results.title: Wayang shadow puppets
results.creator_credit: Putro Wayang Puppet Workshop and Oil Painting
results.brief_description: For centuries, wayang shadow puppets have danced across screens and told stories, teaching philosophical, moral and aesthetic values through indigenous myths, ancient Indian epics and local legends.

constellations_other.name: Storytelling through shadow play
constellations_other.description: Shadow play has brought stories to life for thousands of years and is still used today.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Putro Wayang Puppet Workshop and Oil Painting
results.description:
Wayang shadow puppets like these can be traced back to the first millennium when Hinduism arrived on the Indonesian island of Java. For centuries these puppets have danced across screens and told stories, teaching philosophical, moral and aesthetic values through indigenous myths, ancient Indian epics and local legends.

Intricately perforated and elaborately painted, these puppets are made from leather, bamboo and ox horn, and they cast dazzling shadows when silhouetted against walls or translucent cloths. The dalang, or puppeteer, uses rods to bring the characters to life in performances that are often accompanied by chanting, singing and gamelan.
description_for_label:
Wayang shadow puppets like these can be traced back to the first millennium when Hinduism arrived on the Indonesian island of Java. For centuries these puppets have danced across screens and told stories, teaching philosophical, moral and aesthetic values through indigenous myths, ancient Indian epics and local legends.

Intricately perforated and elaborately painted, these puppets are made from leather, bamboo and ox horn, and they cast dazzling shadows when silhouetted against walls or translucent cloths. The dalang, or puppeteer, uses rods to bring the characters to life in performances that are often accompanied by chanting, singing and gamelan.

results.title: Wayang shadow puppet
results.material_description: leather, ox horn, bamboo, oil paint
results.brief_description: Wayang Kulit shadow puppets depicting a range of 2D character forms made from animal skin, with an attached central pole and two slender side poles made from ox horn. Puppets are painted with oil and gold paint depicitng details of facial features, head-dresses, jewellery and clothing in a range of bright colours, skin of characters is depicted in gold.
results.description: Wayang Kulit shadow puppets depicting a range of 2D character forms made from animal skin, with an attached central pole and two slender side poles made from ox horn. results.title: Wayang Kulit: the shadow puppet theatre of Java
results.creator_credit: Baylis Glascock and Baylis Glascock Films
results.brief_description: This film explores parts of an all night performance of the Wayang Kulit, a traditional Javanese puppet play. The characters in the film are from the Mahabharata, a story of Hindu origin, telling of the great war between the five Pendawa brothers who represent good and their cousins - the Korawas, who represent evil.
results.title_for_label: Wayang Kulit: the shadow puppet theatre of Java
results.description: This film explores parts of an all night performance of the Wayang Kulit, a traditional Javanese puppet play. The characters in the film are from the Mahabharata, a story of Hindu origin, telling of the great war between the five Pendawa brothers who represent good and their cousins - the Korawas, who represent evil.

results.title: Wayang Kulit
results.creator_credit: Zain Hussain, Tom Hodge and Malayan Film Unit
results.brief_description: Shows a travelling troupe, the touring Wayang Kulit or shadow play men, in Malaya. Follows the troupe as it provides this traditional entertainment in the villages and kampongs of Malaya’s east coast.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Zain Hussain, Tom Hodge and Malayan Film Unit
